Lynrick Wix, MSc

Electrical and battery engineer

Vinyl & CD collector and concert enthousiast

Young Aruban engineer who specializes in battery system design, system/cell test and system application. I truly believe that in order to achieve a more sustainable future by means of renewable energy integration, batteries are at the forefront to achieve this whether it be in the mobility or in the energy sector. I have in the past contributed to this at companies such as Tesla, Lightyear and Stedin and I have a desire to continue to contribute to this cause in the future aswell.

I come from a small island in the Caribbean called Aruba. In 2016, I moved from Aruba to the Netherlands to follow my dreams and pursue a degree in Electrical Engineering. I am keen collector of vinyls & CD's and I also enjoy going to concerts of my favorite artists in my free time.

Download CV/Resume
Visit Linkedin page

Tesla - ( 2021 - 2022 )

Amsterdam, the Netherlands

Had the amazing opportunity to work in the Tesla project engineering team for deployment of Tesla's energy products (Megapack and Powerpack) all over Europe, Africa and Middle East. Key contributions to the team and company :

1. I provided multiple site layouts and single line diagrams for tender projects for different clients and commissioned a battery storage site for a client.

2. Made testplans and performed tests on several energy storage sites (Holes Bay and Contego BESS) and test benches in order to comply with G99 grid code requirements and frequency regulation market requirements. Then a documentation was made to keep track for other future BESS sites which tests needs to be performed and how the tests needs to be performed.

Lightyear - ( 2021 )

Helmond, the Netherlands

Lightyear is an electric vehicle startup to commercialize the first solar electric vehicle built in in-house in the Netherlands. I was part of the electrical engineering department with the specialization within the battery department. Key contributions to the team and company :

1. Built the battery cell test setup from the ground up and developed a Matlab graphical user interface in such a way to reduce the amount of manual steps from the start of the test to extraction of valuable data from the tested battery cell. Furthermore, multiple characterization tests and scripts were set up by myself for any engineer or technician to make use of for years to come.

2. Developed an algorithm for calculating the internal resistances and capacitance of battery cells (RRC model) using DCR pulses instead of the costly EIS measurements. Error of the simulated voltage response versus measurements was max 1.15%.

Delft Hyperloop - ( 2019 - 2020 )

Delft, the Netherlands

Delft Hyperloop is a team of engineers who design and build a hyperloop pod to compete at the annual SpaceX Hyperloop Pod competition. Our main accomplishment was reaching a top speed of 360 km/h in a 300 meter open air test track. My responsibilities in the Powertrain department was to coordinate and document every tests within the department and the implementation of the battery management system for the battery pack. Key contributions to the team :

1. Coordinated and co-built an 800A load test setup to verify manufacturer datasheet claims. This ensured that a lightweight battery pack was produced, which resulted in a battery pack weight reduction of 40% compared to the previous team.

2. Co-produced the wiring warness and co-automated a flywheel setup with multiple measurement devices.

Stedin - ( 2023 )

Rotterdam, the Netherlands

Stedin is the distribution system operator for different regions in the Netherlands, which includes major cities such as Rotterdam, the Hague and Utrecht.

Investigated the application of supercapacitors or batteries at a residential level to reduce voltage fluctuations caused cloud passing over PV panels. Successfully commissioned two test setups (Grid connected PV system + BESS) of which one I had installed all of the BESS devices by myself. Finally, I made a graphical user interface in Matlab for both test setups which reads and writes messages to all of the devices in the test setup and builds up a data file to be exported after the test for post processing. Results showed that the designed control algorithm minimized the energy usage from the BESS by only consuming around 28Wh.

European Hyperloop Week - ( 2021 - 2022 )

Delft, the Netherlands/Valencia, Spain

The European Hyperloop Week is an annual international event dedicated to the transport of the future, the Hyperloop. This event enables university students, guest speakers, companies and hyperloop enthusiasts to discuss the technology, feasibility and scalability of the Hyperloop.

I was part of a team of skilled technical jurors for the annual European Hyperloop Week competition. One of my first responsibilities is to assess the design and test documentations of multiple hyperloop teams from around the world to give a go or no go for demonstrating at the public event. Furthermore, I had to assess multiple teams during their presentations of their design for which I mainly focused on the electrical subsystem, traction/propulsion subsystem and full pod awards. Lastly, I also scrutineered multiple teams' pods to ensure safe operation of their pod at the public event.

Master in Electrical Engineering

Delft University of Technology - Delft, the Netherlands

GPA : 7.9/10 and final thesis grade : 8.5/10

Choose to follow the track Electrical Power Engineering and specialized in the Power Electronics and Electrical Power System My electives focused on PV systems, Battery energy storage and optimization. My thesis was done in collaboration with Stedin regarding the use of a battery energy storage to compensate for power fluctuations from solar panels caused by clouds. This in order to mitigate any voltage fluctuations from occurring at household low-voltage level. As of right now, the research from my thesis is planned to be published in a journal article.

Bachelor in Electrical Engineering

Delft University of Technology - Delft, the Netherlands

GPA : 7.8/10 and final thesis grade : 9/10

Followed the bachelor program and finished the program within 3 years with a minor in Spaceflight at the Faculty of Aerospace Engineering at Delft University of Technology. My thesis was done in collaboration with LOBSTER regarding the design for the transmission stage of a deep sea LIDAR system. Our work for the final thesis was also awarded with the IEEE best high tech start-up business plan.

VWO diploma

Colegio Arubano - Oranjestad, Aruba

Attained my high school diploma back in my home country of Aruba. These are following courses I choose to follow during the latter half of my high school period : Dutch, English, Mathematics B, Mathematics D, Physics, Chemistry and Biology.

My hobbies are primarily collecting vinyls or CD's, listening to them on my CD or record player and going to the concerts of my favorite artists. I also enjoy going to the gym a lot as a means of consistently challenging myself physically. Lastly, I am learning how to travel around the city with my longboard and currently I am trying to better my Spanish aswell.

For those who are interested about my vinyl and CD collection, it can be found on my discog account.
